{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A relativistic particle is projected from the origin at time "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with initial velocity "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\vec{v}_o"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The particle experiences a constant force of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\vec{F}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Notes:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Newton's second law reads:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\vec{F} = \frac{d\vec{p}}{dt} \ ; \ \vec{p} = \frac{mc\vec{V}}{\sqrt{c^2 - \lvert \vec{V} \rvert^2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Applying the above to the given scenario results in:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{d}{dt}\left(\frac{v}{\sqrt{1-v^2}}\right) = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v(0) = 0.1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", solving the above differential equation gives:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{v}{\sqrt{1-v^2}} - \frac{0.1}{\sqrt{1-(0.1)^2}} = t"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solving for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v=0.9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives the result:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{t = \frac{9}{\sqrt{19}}-\frac{1}{\sqrt{99}} \approx 1.96425}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The reason I asked the bonus question was to show that in the non-relativistic case, the particle's speed exceeds that of light, which in reality is impossible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Relativistic Newton's 2nd Law (there are no vectors, since the problem is one dimensional):"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F = \frac{d}{dt} p \\
F = \frac{\sqrt{c^2 - v^2} \, m c \, \dot{v} - m c v \, \frac{1}{2} (c^2 - v^2)^{-1/2} \, (-2 v \dot{v})}{c^2 - v^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simplifying results in:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F = (\alpha + \beta) \dot{v} \\
\alpha = \frac{mc}{\sqrt{c^2 - v^2}} \\
\beta = \frac{m c v^2}{(c^2 - v^2)^{3/2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The rest is just number crunching.  In the non-relativistic case, the acceleration would be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the particle would reach "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v = 0.9 c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t = 0.8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  It takes considerably longer in the relativistic case because relativistic particles behave as if they have mass greater than their rest mass."}]},{"type":"text","text":"
